title: Folate metabolism modifies chromosomal damage induced by 1,3-butadiene: results from a match-up study in China and in vitro experiments
reasoning: The abstract discusses the role of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate (5-MTHF) in modifying the chromosomal damage induced by 1,3-Butadiene (BD) and its genotoxic metabolite, 1,2:3,4-diepoxybutane (DEB). It indicates that 5-MTHF supplementation can decrease the frequencies of chromosomal damage, suggesting it may serve as a safer alternative to BD by mitigating its harmful effects.

target_chemical_harm.rationale: The reasoning text explicitly mentions genotoxicity and chromosomal damage associated with 1,3-Butadiene (BD) exposure, as well as a decrease in global DNA methylation levels in TK6 cells due to exposure to its metabolite, 1,2:3,4-diepoxybutane (DEB).

CHEMICAL HARM: genotoxicity, chromosomal damage, decreased global DNA methylation
